title: Is there a physics exam that I may take after +2 and get somewhere? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hello There is no exam in India after 10+2 which conducts only for physics. It is required to know the chemistry and mathematics. But if you want to make your career in physics then first you have to complete BSc in Physics and then appear in IIT JAM Physics Exam. It will provide you many IIT JAM career opportunities after MSc Physics and you will have an opportunity to study in IITs, NITs. Below, you can check some career opportunities in government as well as private sectors. There are many famous firms like CIPLA, Asian paints, ONGC, IOCL including some German and Japanese companies and universities too recruit IIT MSc graduates. There are many companies like Goldman Sachs, Walmart, Dunia Finance, Fuzzy Logics, Amazon, etc. which have offered 20+LPA to the http://M.Sc. students. Research or Scientists Jobs in Defense Research and Development Organization (DRDO), Physical Research Laboratory Ahmedabad, Nuclear Science Centre New Delhi, etc. Officer Jobs in India’s prestigious Government Organizations Assistant Professors at India’s Top Most Universities. There are various posts for http://M.Sc. qualified in Indian Railways. They can work on the following positions Project AssociateTrainee OfficerDeputy Country RepresentativeAssociate Software EngineerHope it will help you. Thank You!!

Unfortunately there isn’t.You will have to take care of maths and chemistry also. But if you have interest in Physics you can study BSc physics and study for three years. After that you can attempt IIT JAM physics for MSC in Physics at IITs. Then you can either go to analytics company or software company if your programming skills are good. Else if you are still interested in Physics then you can persue research or teaching career in Physics. Also having an MSc degree from IIT gives you an edge for applications of research positions in foreign countries like USA, UK, Europe and Taiwan.
